t: Matthew 16
The Leaven of the Pharisees and the Sadducees
The*p Pharisees and Sadducees approached, and tested him, asking him to show them a sign from heaven.
He replied, “When*r evening*r comes*r you*r say,*r ‘It*r will*r be*r good*r weather*r because*r the*r sky*r is*r red.’*r

And*r in*r the*r morning,*r ‘Today*r will*r be*r stormy*r because*r the*r sky*r is*r red*r and*r threatening.’*r You*r know*r how*r to*r read*r the*r appearance*r of*r the*r sky,*r but*r you*r can’t*r read*r the*r signs*r of*r the*r times.*r
An*r evil*r and*r adulterous*r generation*r demands*r a*r sign,*r but*r no*r sign*r will*r be*r given*r to*r it*r except*r the*r sign*r of*r Jonah.”*r Then he left them and went away.
The*p disciples reached the other shore, and they had forgotten to take bread.
Then Jesus told them, “Watch*r out*r and*r beware*r of*r the*r leaven*r of*r the*r Pharisees*r and*r Sadducees.”*r
They*p were discussing among themselves, “We didn’t bring any bread.”
Aware*p of this, Jesus said, “You*r of*r little*r faith,*r why*r are*r you*r discussing*r among*r yourselves*r that*r you*r do*r not*r have*r bread?*r
Don’t*r you*r understand*r yet?*r Don’t*r you*r remember*r the*r five*r loaves*r for*r the*r five*r thousand*r and*r how*r many*r baskets*r you*r collected?*r
Or*r the*r seven*r loaves*r for*r the*r four*r thousand*r and*r how*r many*r large*r baskets*r you*r collected?*r
Why*r is*r it*r you*r don’t*r understand*r that*r when*r I*r told*r you,*r ‘Beware*r of*r the*r leaven*r of*r the*r Pharisees*r and*r Sadducees,’*r it*r wasn’t*r about*r bread?”*r
Then they understood that he had not told them to beware of the leaven in bread, but of the teaching of the Pharisees and Sadducees.
Peter’s Confession of the Messiah
When*p Jesus came to the region of Caesarea Philippi, he asked his disciples, “Who*r do*r people*r say*r that*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r is?”*r
They*p replied, “Some say John the Baptist; others, Elijah; still others, Jeremiah or one of the prophets.”
“But*rp you,”*r he asked them, “who*r do*r you*r say*r that*r I*r am?”*r
Simon*p Peter answered, “You are the Messiah, the Son of the living God.”
Jesus*p responded, “Blessed*r are*r you,*r Simon*r son*r of*r Jonah,*r because*r flesh*r and*r blood*r did*r not*r reveal*r this*r to*r you,*r but*r my*r Father*r in*r heaven.*r
And*r I*r also*r say*r to*r you*r that*r you*r are*r Peter,*r and*r on*r this*r rock*r I*r will*r build*r my*r church,*r and*r the*r gates*r of*r Hades*r will*r not*r overpower*r it.*r

I*r will*r give*r you*r the*r keys*r of*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven,*r and*r whatever*r you*r bind*r on*r earth*r will*r have*r been*r bound*r in*r heaven,*r and*r whatever*r you*r loose*r on*r earth*r will*r have*r been*r loosed*r in*r heaven.”*r
Then he gave the disciples orders to tell no one that he was the Messiah.
His Death and Resurrection Predicted

From*p then on Jesus began to point out to his disciples that it was necessary for him to go to Jerusalem and suffer many things from the elders, chief priests, and scribes, be killed, and be raised the third day.
Peter took him aside and began to rebuke him, “Oh no, Lord! This will never happen to you!”
Jesus*p turned and told Peter, “Get*r behind*r me,*r Satan!*r You*r are*r a*r hindrance*r to*r me*r because*r you’re*r not*r thinking*r about*r God’s*r concerns*r but*r human*r concerns.”*r
Take Up Your Cross
Then*p Jesus said to his disciples, “If*r anyone*r wants*r to*r follow*r after*r me,*r let*r him*r deny*r himself,*r take*r up*r his*r cross,*r and*r follow*r me.*r
For*r whoever*r wants*r to*r save*r his*r life*r will*r lose*r it,*r but*r whoever*r loses*r his*r life*r because*r of*r me*r will*r find*r it.*r
For*r what*r will*r it*r benefit*r someone*r if*r he*r gains*r the*r whole*r world*r yet*r loses*r his*r life?*r Or*r what*r will*r anyone*r give*r in*r exchange*r for*r his*r life?*r
For*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r is*r going*r to*r come*r with*r his*r angels*r in*r the*r glory*r of*r his*r Father,*r and*r then*r he*r will*r reward*r each*r according*r to*r what*r he*r has*r done.*r
Truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r there*r are*r some*r standing*r here*r who*r will*r not*r taste*r death*r until*r they*r see*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r coming*r in*r his*r kingdom.”*r
